intro: Paliurus spina-christi var. macrocarpus, commonly known as the large-fruited Chinese thornapple, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to China. It belongs to the Rhamnaceae family and is characterized by its thorny branches and small, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by distinctive, inflated, spiny fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is cultivated in some regions for both horticultural and medicinal purposes.
